Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel with a red external slip, on which are the faded remains of two lines of Greek text in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.180-181)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36418) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36418)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 276 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
